description:
Apex Systems is a world class technology services business that incorporates industry or insights and experience to deliver solutions that fulfill our clients' digital visions. Apex has an opportunity for a Software Engineer. For applicants who are interested in this opportunity, send your updated resume to Mike Konjoian, Account Manager, at mkonjoian@apexsystems.com. Here are the details:

Position: Software Engineer
Location: Tucson Arizona -- On-Site
Project Duration: 12 months w/ possibility of extension or conversion
Rate: Negotiable Based on Experience
Security Clearance: Active Secret Clearance Required

Position Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer with a strong background in object-oriented software development using C# and C++ within Microsoft Visual Studio on Windows OS. This role is ideal for candidates with a STEM degree and 5+ years of industry experience, or 3+ years with an advanced degree, who thrive in a multidisciplinary engineering team environment.

Position Details:
The Test Equipment Engineering (TEE) team within the Specialty Engineering Directorate is a multi-discipline organization responsible for developing advanced windows application solutions for all Raytheon products. We are hands-on, designing with the latest technology and tools, and integrating state of the art software solutions with the most advanced engineering systems in the world.

Key Responsibilities:
- Design, develop, and integrate object-oriented software applications using C# and C++
- Troubleshoot software and test equipment instrumentation
- Prioritize and manage multiple software engineering tasks concurrently
- Lead and mentor junior software engineers
- Develop and derive software product requirements
- Create and optimize computer architectures and hardware interfaces

Required Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics)
- Minimum 5 years of relevant industry experience, or 3 years with an advanced degree
- Proficiency in C#, C++, and Microsoft Visual Studio
- Experience with Windows OS development
- Active Secret Security Clearance required at start
- U.S. Citizenship required

Additional Information:
Work Schedule: 9/80 (every other Friday off)
Exempt Status: Determined by supplier based on FLSA guidelines
Start Authorization: Must have active clearance to begin
duration: 12 months w/ possibility of extension or conversion

description:
Low Voltage Technician (Contract)
To apply email Valentina Jimenez at vjimenez@apexsystems.com with an updated resume

Location: Baltimore, MD
Start Date: ASAP
Contract Length: Until end of March 2026
Shift: Monday–Friday, 7:00 AM – 3:30 PM EST
Pay Rate: $31/hour

About the Role
We are hiring two experienced Low Voltage Technicians for a short-term contract opportunity in Baltimore, MD. You'll be joining a collaborative team environment on a large-scale infrastructure project. This is a great opportunity for professionals with strong technical skills and a proactive attitude.

Key Responsibilities:
- Splicing fiber and copper cables
- Pulling and routing cable
- Terminating and testing shielded copper (CAT 6 and CAT 6a)
- Supporting daily operations on-site

Required Skills & Experience:
- Hands-on experience with fiber cable splicing
- Proficiency in copper shielded termination, splicing, and testing
- Strong communication and teamwork skills
- Ability to work full-time on-site

Work Authorization & Clearance:
- U.S. Citizenship required
- Top Secret clearance preferred, Secret clearance acceptable

Title: Networking Director
Location: 100% Remote
Direct Fulltime Hire with Client
Clearance requirement: TS/SCI - CI POLY

Pay Breakdown:
- Base Salary $190-220,000
- $47k LTI (Stock option plan) – stocks are paid out quarterly, fully vested in 3 years, half cash/half stock
- STI: 25% (Short Term Incentive) – paid out every March

APPLY HERE: If you currently have an active TS/SCI clearance with CI polygraph and you meet the basic requirements please send Skylar a copy of your resume at sarias@apexsystems.com

Job Details:
We are seeking a Network Engineer to support high-value public- and private-sector customers. You will be primarily responsible for deploying, configuring, and securing network security gear, with a strong emphasis on optical fiber installation, testing, and maintenance.

Responsibilities:
- Deploy, configure, and maintain routers, switches, firewalls, and VPNs across data center and field environments
- Install, terminate, and test optical fiber (single-mode and multi-mode), and end-to-end troubleshooting
- Serve as a trusted technical contact for customers, vendors, and peers during deployments and escalations
- Produce clear, reusable technical documentation including network diagrams, Methods of Procedure (MoPs), and runbooks
- Travel domestically as required to support surveys, installations, and cutovers

Requirements:
- Active TS/SCI clearance with CI polygraph
- 8+ years of progressively responsible experience in network engineering or security operations
- Strong hands-on expertise with optical fiber (testing and troubleshooting across single-mode and multi-mode)
- Proven experience with routed and switched networks: TCP/IP, Ethernet, VLANs, IPsec, VPNs, and firewalls
- Background in system, network, or security administration (Unix/Linux preferred)

Preferred:
- Experience with SD-WAN platforms (e.g., Fortinet, Juniper, Viptela, Aruba) and load balancers (F5, Citrix)
- Familiarity with NIST standards, DISA STIGs, TIC 3.0, and Zero Trust architectures

Position: DCGS Intelligence Analyst
Location: San Diego, CA (On-Site)
Duration: 12+ months
Clearance: Active TS/SCI Required

Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Intelligence Analyst to support the Air Force Distributed Common Ground System (DCGS) at the PACAF node in San Diego. This is a critical role supporting ISR operations for Pacific theater intelligence requirements.

Responsibilities:
- Analyze multi-source intelligence data to support ISR mission requirements
- Produce intelligence products and briefings for tactical and operational customers
- Collaborate with 480th ISR Wing analysts and PACAF leadership
- Support quality assurance for intelligence dissemination
- Maintain current knowledge of regional threats and collection capabilities
- Interface with coalition partners on shared intelligence matters

Required Qualifications:
- Active TS/SCI clearance
- 5+ years intelligence analysis experience
- Experience with DCGS or similar ISR ground systems
- Understanding of Air Force ISR operations
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Bachelor's degree in relevant field

Preferred:
- GEOINT or SIGINT specialty training
- Pacific theater experience
- Prior military intelligence background

Position: Network Engineer
Location: Hampton, VA (Langley AFB Area)
Duration: Full-time hire with benefits
Clearance: TS/SCI Required

Overview:
Join the 480th ISR Wing support team at DGS-1 (Langley) as a Network Engineer supporting the Air Force Distributed Common Ground System. This is a full-time opportunity with excellent benefits and career growth.

Position Details:
The DGS-1 site at Langley AFB is the premier Air Force ground station for ISR processing. You'll be part of a team maintaining critical intelligence networks supporting global operations.

Key Responsibilities:
- Maintain and troubleshoot classified network infrastructure
- Implement network security controls per DISA STIGs
- Support RMF accreditation activities
- Coordinate with site lead on capacity planning
- Respond to network incidents and escalations
- Document network configurations and changes

Required Qualifications:
- Active TS/SCI clearance
- 5+ years network engineering experience
- Cisco certifications (CCNA minimum, CCNP preferred)
- Experience with classified network environments
- Knowledge of DISA STIGs and RMF
- Security+ or equivalent IAT II certification

Benefits:
- Comprehensive health insurance
- 401k with matching
- Paid time off
- Professional development support

Position: Senior Cyber Analyst
Location: Dayton, OH (Wright-Patterson AFB)
Duration: Long-term contract with possible conversion
Clearance: TS/SCI with CI Polygraph

Overview:
Support the National Air and Space Intelligence Center (NASIC) with advanced cyber threat analysis. This role requires deep technical expertise and the ability to work in a highly classified environment.

The Role:
As a Senior Cyber Analyst, you will provide technical analysis of adversary cyber capabilities to support Air Force and national intelligence customers. This position is located at Wright-Patterson AFB supporting NASIC mission requirements.

Responsibilities:
- Conduct technical analysis of cyber threats to DoD systems
- Produce finished intelligence products on adversary cyber capabilities
- Brief senior leadership on analytical findings
- Collaborate with IC partners on joint assessments
- Maintain expertise in evolving cyber threat landscape
- Support DCGS technical refresh initiatives

Required:
- Active TS/SCI with CI Polygraph
- 8+ years cyber analysis experience
- Deep knowledge of nation-state cyber actors
- Experience with intelligence production
- Strong technical writing skills
- Bachelor's degree (Master's preferred)

Desired:
- Malware reverse engineering experience
- Programming/scripting skills
- Previous NASIC or DIA experience

Position: Systems Administrator
Location: Norfolk, VA
Duration: 6+ months contract
Clearance: Secret (TS eligible preferred)

About the Role:
Provide systems administration support for Navy DCGS-N operations at Naval Station Norfolk. This is an excellent opportunity to gain experience with Navy intelligence systems.

Daily Responsibilities:
- Administer Windows and Linux servers in classified environment
- Perform system patching and vulnerability remediation
- Monitor system performance and capacity
- Support user account administration
- Maintain system documentation
- Coordinate with Navy IT security team

Must Have:
- Active Secret clearance (TS eligible a plus)
- 3+ years systems administration experience
- Windows Server and Red Hat Linux experience
- Security+ certification
- Strong troubleshooting skills
- U.S. Citizenship

Nice to Have:
- Navy IT experience
- VMware administration
- DoD RMF experience
- Splunk or similar SIEM experience

jobTitle: Deputy Program Manager - GDIT Intelligence Programs
description:
Position: Deputy Program Manager
Location: Herndon, VA (Hybrid)
Type: Full-time Direct Hire
Clearance: TS/SCI Required

Company Overview:
Join GDIT's growing intelligence programs division as a Deputy Program Manager supporting multiple DoD and IC contracts.

Position Summary:
The Deputy Program Manager will support oversight of intelligence IT programs valued at $50M+. This role requires strong leadership skills and experience managing cleared technical teams.

Key Responsibilities:
- Support PM in day-to-day program operations
- Manage subcontractor relationships and performance
- Track program financials and deliverables
- Lead proposal efforts for new business
- Ensure contract compliance and customer satisfaction
- Develop and mentor program staff
- Represent program at customer meetings

Requirements:
- Active TS/SCI clearance
- 10+ years program management experience
- PMP certification
- Experience with DoD/IC contracts
- Strong financial management skills
- Excellent communication abilities
- Bachelor's degree (Master's preferred)

Compensation:
- Base salary $160-180K
- Annual bonus potential
- Full benefits package
- 401k matching

Position: DevSecOps Engineer
Location: Colorado Springs, CO
Duration: 12 months (extendable)
Clearance: Secret (TS/SCI preferred)

The Opportunity:
Join our team supporting Space Force DevSecOps initiatives at Peterson SFB. This is a hands-on role for engineers passionate about automating secure software delivery.

What You'll Do:
- Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitLab and Jenkins
- Implement security controls in automated pipelines
- Support container orchestration with Kubernetes
- Automate infrastructure with Terraform and Ansible
- Collaborate with development teams on secure coding practices
- Maintain documentation for DevSecOps processes

What You Bring:
- Active Secret clearance (TS/SCI preferred)
- 5+ years software engineering or DevOps experience
- Strong scripting skills (Python, Bash)
- Experience with container technologies
- Knowledge of DoD DevSecOps practices
- Security+ or equivalent

Bonus Points:
- Platform One experience
- Kubernetes certifications
- Cloud experience (AWS/Azure GovCloud)
- Prior Space Force/Air Force experience

Position: IT Help Desk Technician
Location: San Antonio, TX (JBSA-Lackland)
Duration: Long-term contract
Clearance: Secret Required

Role Overview:
Provide Tier 1/2 IT support for Air Force users at Joint Base San Antonio. This is an entry-level cleared position with growth opportunities.

Day-to-Day:
- Answer help desk calls and tickets
- Troubleshoot hardware and software issues
- Reset passwords and manage user accounts
- Image and deploy workstations
- Document support activities
- Escalate complex issues appropriately

Requirements:
- Active Secret clearance
- 1+ years IT support experience
- CompTIA A+ certification
- Strong customer service skills
- Ability to work shifts
- High school diploma (Associate's preferred)

Growth Path:
This role offers advancement to Tier 2/3 support positions with additional training and certifications. We support professional development and certification goals.
